A Shadow warrior is a deceased knight, found in the basement of the Legends' Guild. They are considered undead, however, so the salve amulet has an effect on them. They drop crimson charms frequently. Tier 60 equipment or higher will reliably kill them. They do not count for the shadow creature Slayer assignment.

After completion of Legends' Quest, Shadow warriors are also a slayer task given by Chaeldar and Mazchna. Shadow warriors appear to be wielding battleaxes, but they attack at the fast speed of scimitars (2.4 seconds, or 4 ticks).

Shadow Boxing is a hard Ardougne achievement which requires the player to kill a shadow warrior.

Shadow warriors do not appear on the minimap.

Rare drop table[edit | edit source]

This monster has access to the rare drop table.
Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but they will increase the chance of accessing the rare drop table and may also improve the loot received from it.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.
Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Key token1RareNot soldNot alchemisable
Mimic kill token (m)11/10,00095,216Not alchemisable

Achievements[edit | edit source]

  • Shadow Boxing ( 15) – Kill a shadow warrior in the Legends' Guild basement.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 17 April 2023 (Update):
    • Fixed the issue of incorrect souls being captured by Ushabti.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Updated Undead Slayer categories gamewide.
  • ninja 17 January 2022 (Update):
    • Replaced an old version of weapon poison drops on various NPCs with the correct version of weapon poison.
  • update 23 August 2003 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • They still use the old RuneScape 2 animations.
  • The examine info 'He's a shadow of his former self' is a reference to the popular phrase.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Stu's Twitter account. 17 November 2017. (Archived from the original on 22 January 2019.) Mod Stu: "Had a look at the code: * It only drops on member worlds * Looks like a 1/1,000 drop chance, no modifiers * It just flags a variable and messages "You have unlocked the ability to burn bones on bonfires!", so it's easy to miss you've unlocked it"
